column3: Dermatite seborréica;Papular pruritic eruptions;Herpes zoster;Fungal nail infections of fingers;Recurrent respiratory tract infections;Moderate unexplained weight loss (<10% of body weight);Angular cheilitis;Recurrent oral ulcerations (≥2 episodes in 6 months)

Unexplained anemia (<8g/dL);Bacteremia;Oral candidiasis;Unexplained chronic diarrhea for longer than one month (>1 month);Severe pelvic inflammatory disease;Empyema;ulcerative;Unexplained persistent fever (intermittent or constant > 1 month);Gingivitis;Joint or Bone Infections;Oral Hairy Leukoplakia;Meningitis;Unexplained Neutropenia (< 500/mm3);Unexplained severe weight loss (> 10% of total weight);Acute Necrotizing Ulcerative Periodontitis;Pyomyositis;Pneumonia;Pulmonary TB;Chronic Unexplained Thrombocytopenia (<50.000/mm3)

Esophageal candidiasis;Invasive Cervical Carcinoma (Women);Symptomatic HIV-related   Cardiomyopathy;Extrapulmonary Cryptococcosis (meningitis included);Chronic Cryptosporidiosis (with diarrhea);HIV Encephalopathy (AIDS Dementia Complex);Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial or on skin ≥ 1 month’s duration) or visceral or elsewhere;Cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection;Disseminated non-tuberculous mycobacteria infection;Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML);Lymphoma (cerebral or B cell non-Hodgkin)5;IV-related kidney disease;Severe Recurrent Bacterial Pneumonia (≥2 episodes in last 6 months);Pneumocystis Jirovecii Pneumonia (PCP);Sarcoma de Kaposi;Cachexia;Extrapulmonary or Disseminated TB;Central Nervous System (CNS) Toxoplasmosis
